1.text: My brethren, do not hold the faith of our Lord of glory Jesus Christ with partiality.

2.text: Yet, if someone with a gold ring and fine clothing comes into your synagogue, and a poor man in filthy clothing also comes in,

3.text: you pay special attention to the one who wears the fine clothing! To the rich you say, “Sit here in a good place,” but you tell the poor man, “Stand over there,” or “Sit here by my footstool!”

4.text: Have you not shown partiality among yourselves and become judges with evil thoughts?

5.text: Listen, my beloved brethren: did not God choose the poor of the world [to be] rich in faith and heirs of the Kingdom which he promised to those who love him?

6.text: Yet, you have dishonored the poor! Is it not the rich who oppress you and personally drag you before the courts?

7.text: Do they not blaspheme the honorable Name by which you are called?

8.text: However, if you fulfill the royal law found in the Scripture, “You shall love your neighbor as yourself,” you do well.

9.text: But if you discriminate, you commit sin and you are convicted by the law as transgressors.

10.text: Truly, whoever keeps the whole law and yet stumbles in one point has become guilty of everything.

11.text: For he who said, “Do not commit adultery” also said “Do not commit murder.” Now if you do not commit adultery but do commit murder, you have become a transgressor of the law.

12.text: And so, speak and act as people who are going to be judged by a law of freedom.

13.text: Indeed, judgment is without mercy to those who have shown no mercy, but mercy triumphs over judgment.

14.text: What good is it, my brethren, if someone claims to have faith but has no works? Can faith save such a person?

15.text: If a brother or sister is in rags and lacking daily food,

16.text: and one of you tells them, “Go in peace, be warmed and filled,” and does not give them what the body needs, what good is that?

17.text: Likewise faith, if it has no works, is dead in itself.

18.text: Yes, someone will say, “You have faith, and I have works!” Show me your faith by your works, and by my works, I will show you my faith.

19.text: You believe that God is one! You do well! The demons also believe, and they shudder.

20.text: O ignorant one! Will you not recognize that apart from works, faith is dead?

21.text: Was not our father Abraham justified by works, by offering up his son Isaac on the altar?

22.text: You can see that [his] faith was working with his actions, and that by works, faith was perfected.

23.text: Thus, the Scripture which says, “Abraham believed God, and it was accounted to him as righteousness” was fulfilled, and he was called the friend of God.

24.text: You see, then, that one is justified by works, and not only by faith.

25.text: In the same way, was not Rahab the prostitute also justified by works, by receiving the messengers and sending them out another way?

26.text: For just as the body is dead apart from the spirit, so is faith dead apart from works.
